attributes.action: Reduce the disproportion time between the start of Greenwich Meantime and the shortest day
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Daylight Saving time typically begins on the final Sunday in October, ie 7 weeks before the shortest day, 21st December. The clocks are then not moved forward until the final Sunday in March, ie 14 weeks from the shortest day.
Given that there is an influential lobby against the abolition of Daylight saving Time, would a suitable compromise be to end D.S.T. at circa 7 weeks from the 21st December, ie mid February, and thus bring forward by 7 weeks an extra hour of daylight .
